title: Influence Morphology of Platelet-Shape for the Antibacterial Properties of ZnO Nanostructures
content: Zinc oxide is a semiconductor renowned in the industry for its high chemical stability, ease of synthesis, non-toxicity, and relatively low cost [1]. The engineering of ZnO nanostructures (nZnO) has been achieved by controlling size and crystalline facets, enabling various applications. Morphology plays a pivotal role in its antibacterial properties, and the presence of defects in its structure is noteworthy. Recent research focuses on synthesizing and characterizing platelet and quasi-rounded morphologies to determine their antimicrobial properties in the presence of oxygen vacancies (Vo) [2-9].
